Docs.param: Client ID (also known as App ID) of the application as registered in the application registration portal (https://aka.ms/msal-net-register-app)/.
Docs.summary: Creates a PublicClientApplicationBuilder from a clientID. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-application-configuration

Docs.returns: A from which to set more parameters, and to create a public client application instance

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool IsBrokerAvailable() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns true if a broker can be used.
Docs.remarks:
On Windows, the broker (WAM) can be used on Win10 and is always installed. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-wam On Mac, Linux and older versions of Windows a broker is not available. If your application is .NET5, please use the target .net5.0-windows10.0.17763.0 for all Windows versions and target net5.0 to target Linux and Mac. If your application is .NET classic or .NET Core 3.1 and you wish to use the Windows Broker, please install Microsoft.Identity.Client.Desktop first and call WithDesktopFeatures().
On mobile, the device must be Intune joined and Authenticator or Company Portal must be installed. See https://aka.ms/msal-brokers

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Identity.Client.PublicClientApplicationBuilder WithBroker(bool enableBroker) cil managed
Public Function WithBroker (Optional enableBroker As Boolean = true) As PublicClientApplicationBuilder

Docs.param: Determines whether or not to use broker with the default set to true.
Docs.summary:
Brokers enable Single-Sign-On, device identification, and application identification verification. To enable one of these features, you need to set the WithBroker() parameters to true. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-brokers for more information on platform specific settings required to enable the broker.
On iOS and Android, Authenticator and Company Portal serve as brokers. On Windows, WAM (Windows Account Manager) serves as broker. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-wam
Docs.returns: A from which to set more parameters, and to create a public client application instance
Docs.remarks: If your app uses .NET classic or .NET Core 3.x, and you wish to use the Windows broker, please install the nuget package Microsoft.Identity.Client.Desktop and call .WithDesktopFeatures()

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Identity.Client.PublicClientApplicationBuilder WithDefaultRedirectUri() cil managed

Docs.summary:
Configures the public client application to use the recommended reply URI for the platform. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-default-reply-uri. PlatformDefault Reply URI
.NET desktophttps://login.microsoftonline.com/common/oauth2/nativeclient
UWPvalue of WebAuthenticationBroker.GetCurrentApplicationCallbackUri()
For system browser on .NET Corehttp://localhost NOTE:There will be an update to the default redirect URI in the future to accommodate for system browsers on the .NET desktop and .NET Core platforms.
Docs.returns: A from which to set more parameters, and to create a public client application instance

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Identity.Client.PublicClientApplicationBuilder WithIosKeychainSecurityGroup(string keychainSecurityGroup) cil managed
Public Function WithIosKeychainSecurityGroup (keychainSecurityGroup As String) As PublicClientApplicationBuilder

Docs.summary: You can specify a Keychain Access Group to use for persisting the token cache across multiple applications. This enables you to share the token cache between several applications having the same Keychain access group. Sharing the token cache allows single sign-on between all of the applications that use the same Keychain access Group. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-ios-keychain-security-group for more information.
Docs.returns: A from which to set more parameters, and to create a public client application instance

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Identity.Client.PublicClientApplicationBuilder WithParentActivityOrWindow(class System.Func`1<object> parentActivityOrWindowFunc) cil managed
Public Function WithParentActivityOrWindow (parentActivityOrWindowFunc As Func(Of Object)) As PublicClientApplicationBuilder

Docs.param: The parent as an object, so that it can be used from shared NetStandard assemblies
Docs.summary: Sets a reference to the ViewController (if using Xamarin.iOS), Activity (if using Xamarin.Android) IWin32Window or IntPtr (if using .Net Framework). Used for invoking the browser.
Docs.returns: The builder to chain the .With methods
Docs.remarks: Mandatory only on Android to be set either from here or from AcquireTokenInteractive builder. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-android-activity for further documentation and details.
